description: Transmission Park Position Sensor/Switch A/B Circuit Correlation
info: This is a generic powertrain diagnostic trouble code (DTC) and applies to OBD-II vehicles that have a transmission park position switch/sensor. That may include but is not limited to vehicles from Dodge, Ford, Toyota, Land Rover, VW, Chevrolet, etc. Although generic, the exact repair steps may vary depending on year, make, model and powertrain configuration.
Trouble code P07BE is one of several possible codes associated to the Transmission Park Position Sensor/Switch circuit.

This code is an indication that the Powertrain Control Module (PCM) has detected a correlation problem between the "A" and "B" transmission park position sensor/switch circuits. The specific situation determines the code activated by the PCM and the check engine light or the service engine soon light will be illuminated.

The purpose of the transmission park position sensor/switch circuit is to monitor the status of the transmission. This circuit sends a signal to the PCM when the transmission is placed into the park position. Based on the specific vehicle, this circuit is commonly a safety feature to prevent the starter from engaging with the automatic transmission in gear.
Refer to a vehicle specific repair manual to determine the location of the A and B circuits in your particular application.
symptoms:
Vehicle will not start (starter will not engage)
Starter will engage with the vehicle in gear
An illuminated Service Engine Soon Light
Check Engine Light is illuminated
Transmission may not shift out of park
Transmission may not shift into park
causes:
Defective transmission park position sensor/switch
Corroded or damaged connector
Damaged or faulty wiring
Defective PCM
